intro: Siphocampylus oaxacanus, commonly known as the Oaxacan siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Siphocampylus oaxacanus is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare species.
